did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Hall of Kilwinning Crosse Lodge No. 2-237 Ledger, 1902-1911

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Hall of Kilwinning Crosse Lodge No. 2-237 Ledger. Local government records collection, Caroline County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of records from Caroline County.
This collection is located at the State Records Center. Contact Archives Research Services for access information, directions, and hours.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Caroline County was named for Caroline of Anspach, consort of George II. It was formed from Essex, King and Queen, and King William Counties in 1728, and additional partf of King and Queen were added later.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Hall of Kilwinning Crosse Lodge No. 2-237 Ledger, 1902-1911. The ledger contains the names of members and the amount they paid in dues. The ledger also contains loose pages, including a report of the Special Finance Committee, 1909, an audit of the Treasurer's book for the year 1910, bank receipts, cancelled checks, and letterhead from businesses in Bowling Green, Virginia.

controlaccess.head: Corporate Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Freemasons. Hall of Kilwinning Crosse Lodge N. 2-237 (Bowling Green, Va.)
